titleNullable: Impact of Maternal Mental Health on Infant Sleep
descriptionNullable:
_____
# Impact of Maternal Mental Health on Infant Sleep
### Exploring Mediators and Moderators
By  [[source]](https://zenodo.org/record/5070945#.Y8OqatJBwUE)
_____

### About this dataset
> This dataset contains data from a study that aims to explore the unique effects of maternal mental health difficulties, such as postpartum depression, anxiety, or childbirth-related posttraumatic stress disorder (CB-PTSD), on infant sleep. It includes 410 mothers and their infants aged between 3 to 12 months old.  Complex information related to the mother's psychological status and sociodemographic data (e.g., maternal age, marital status, and educational level) as well as crucial infant characteristics (e.g., age and temperament) were collected using standardised questionnaires. Furthermore, input regarding specific sleeping habits was also obtained in order to gain a deep understanding of how maternal mental health may influence an infant's quality of sleep. We encourage researchers interested in these topics to download our dataset for further exploration!

### More Datasets
> For more datasets, click [here](https://www.kaggle.com/thedevastator/datasets).

### Featured Notebooks
> - 🚨 **Your notebook can be here!** 🚨! 

### How to use the dataset
> This dataset is a great resource for researchers and professionals looking to investigate the impact of maternal mental health difficulties on infant sleep. It includes 410 mothers of infants aged between 3 to 12 months old, providing invaluable insights into this important area. 
> 
> The data covers a variety of topics, including sociodemographic data (e.g., maternal age, marital status, and educational level) as well as maternal mental health data (such as CB-PTSD, depression and anxiety) and infant sleep patterns (e.g., duration and number of night awakenings). 
> 
> In order to make the most out of this dataset researchers can use various analytical tools such as descriptive statistics or regression models in order to study different aspects such as the association between sociodemographics or mental health difficulty with regards to infant sleep duration or quality. Additionally, potential mediators and moderators can be identified by studying specific subgroups within the sample in more depth or making comparisons with other datasets available online which measure similar variables. 
> 
> Using this dataset it will also be possible to gain further insight into key factors that might influence mothers' decisions when it comes to their children's sleeping habits (i.g., whether they should share the same bed with their baby)

### Research Ideas
> - Investigating the relationship between maternal mental health difficulties, such as postpartum depression and anxiety, and infant sleep patterns.  
> - Examining the role of mediators, such as sociodemographic characteristics (age, education level) in moderating the relationship between maternal mental health difficulty and infant’s sleep patterns. 
> - Investigating how various factors (e.g., maternal age, gender of the baby, etc.) affect infants’ sleeping habits and quality of sleep throughout infancy up to one-year-old infancy stages by analyzing changes in certain variables across all months included in this dataset

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> [Data Source](https://zenodo.org/record/5070945#.Y8OqatJBwUE)
> 
>


### License
> 
> 
> **License: [CC0 1.0 Universal (CC0 1.0) - Public Domain Dedication](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)**
> No Copyright - You can copy, modify, distribute and perform the work, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission. [See Other Information](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

### Columns

**File: Dataset_maternal_mental_health_infant_sleep.csv**
| Column name                 | Description                                                                                                               |
|:----------------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Participant_number**      | Unique identifier for each participant. (Integer)                                                                         |
| **Type_parents**            | Type of parents (single or couple). (String)                                                                              |
| **Birth_1mth_M_inclusion**  | Whether the participant was included in the study at 1 month post-birth. (Boolean)                                        |
| **Birth_12mth_M_inclusion** | Whether the participant was included in the study at 12 months post-birth. (Boolean)                                      |
| **Age**                     | Age of the mother. (Integer)                                                                                              |
| **Marital_status**          | Marital status of the mother. (String)                                                                                    |
| **Marital_status_Autre**    | Other marital status of the mother. (String)                                                                              |
| **Marital_status_edit**     | Edited marital status of the mother. (String)                                                                             |
| **Education**               | Education level of the mother. (String)                                                                                   |
| **Gestationnal_age**        | Gestation age of the infant. (Integer)                                                                                    |
| **Type_pregnancy**          | Type of pregnancy (natural or assisted). (String)                                                                         |
| **sex_baby1**               | Sex of the infant. (String)                                                                                               |
| **CBTS_M_3**                | Score from the Childbirth-related Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (CB-PTSD) questionnaire at 3 months post-birth. (Integer) |
| **CBTS_M_4**                | Score from the Childbirth-related Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (CB-PTSD) questionnaire at 4 months post-birth. (Integer) |
| **CBTS_M_5**                | Score from the Childbirth-related Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (CB-PTSD) questionnaire at 5 months post-birth. (Integer) |
| **CBTS_M_6**                | Score from the Childbirth-related Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (CB-PTSD) questionnaire at 6 months post-birth. (Integer) |
| **CBTS_M_7**                | Score from the Childbirth-related Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (CB-PTSD) questionnaire at 7 months post-birth. (Integer) |
| **CBTS_M_8**                | Score from the Childbirth-related Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (CB-PTSD) questionnaire at 8 months post-birth. (Integer) |
| **CBTS_M_9**                | Score from the Childbirth-related Post                                                                                    |

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit [](https://zenodo.org/record/5070945#.Y8OqatJBwUE).
